Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: முன்னுறக் காவாது இழுக்கியான் தன்பிழை பின்னூறு இரங்கி விடும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The thoughtless man, who provides not against the calamities that may happen, will afterwards repent for his fault.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown walking carelessly ('இழுக்கியான்'), ignoring the clear warning signs of a storm approaching on the horizon ('முன்னுறக் காவாது').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The storm hits with full force. The person is now drenched, miserable, and their house in the background is shown being destroyed by the calamity.
Layered_Composition.Background: In the aftermath, the storm has passed, and the person is sitting amidst the ruins of their life, their face a mask of deep regret and sorrow for their own mistake ('தன்பிழை பின்னூறு இரங்கி விடும்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: One who fails to take precautions against foreseeable problems will surely come to regret their negligence later.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The approaching storm is the foreseeable calamity. The person's initial carelessness contrasts sharply with their final state of regret. The ruined house symbolizes the consequences of their lack of foresight.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Regretful, tragic, cautionary, a story of preventable loss.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The scene transitions from a bright but ominous light before the storm, to dark and chaotic during the storm, to a bleak, grey, post-storm light for the final scene of regret.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A three-act narrative composition within a single image, showing the before, during, and after of the disaster.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Dynamic, storytelling lighting that changes with the narrative.

Cultural_Anchors: Regretting one's fault later ('பின்னூறு இரங்கி விடும்')

Negative_Prompt: person preparing for the storm, house being safe, happy expression at the end, text artifacts.
